Normalize text nodes when removing the markers.

Normalize text nodes when removing the markers.

Placing the markers may have split a text node. If we don't sew it up when
removing the markers and the user presses space between the nodes, the browser
will insert an ` ` and that will cause word wrapping issues.

Observing 'attributes' is unnecessary

Merge pull request #353 from aaalsaleh/master

  UndoManager Improvements (Firefox Freezing Fix)

Firefox freezing fix

Avoiding passing options to prevent Firefox testing from freezing. Now, the interval option is changed before starting the tests. These tests assume typing events to be not merge (old undo manager behavior), and therefore, interval must be 0 with the new undo manager to behave as expected.

Merge pull request #349 from guardian/rr-test-ff-36

Merge pull request #350 from guardian/revert-346-master

Revert "UndoManager Improvements"

Merge pull request #351 from guardian/rr-chrome-40

Testing: add Chrome 40

Merge pull request #346 from aaalsaleh/master

UndoManager Improvements

New testing example

Showcase how two scribe instances can share one undo manager. The example also provides visualization of the current state of the undo manager stack. Can be useful for tracing and verifying the undo manager transactions.

Improving UndoManager space and time efficiency

Before this update, each history item stored both the previous and the current content. This means there are redundancies between every pair of history items. This update removed the need to store the previous content by only storing a reference to the previous item. This way, only current content is saved in each history item. Now we are storing a reference to the last history item to improve access time and content retrieval/update. Memory space cannot be saved more than this, unless a diff algorithm is used to only store the differences (which can be inefficient time-wise, and more complex with undo/redo)

Adding manager option, and saving initial content

Adding external undo manager support by introducing `manager` option. This allows sharing one global undo manager with multiple scribe instances. Also, taking care of when there is content in the contenteditable area before even instantiating scribe (or when setContent is never called).

Removing a no longer needed measure

Force pushing a history on focus is no longer needed with the new undo manager. When scribe is instantiated, its initial content is saved in _previousContent. Also, whenever setContent is called, the new content is also saved in _previousContent. This means the next real change transaction will be aware of the previous content whether it was from an empty scribe, or one that was set using setContent.

Refactoring and updating _previousContent properly

An important refactoring and update. _previousContent is now updated using getHTML from inside setHTML. It makes sure the current and the previous content are using the same method to get the content html. Also, setting _previousContent inside setHTML, ensures it gets updated when undoing and redoing automatically (since it is used by restoreFromHistory).

Changing interval option only

Changing interval option to be 0. Nothing else was changed in the tests. This is important, since the tests assume typing two consecutive numbers to be separate transactions. With the default interval (1000), they should be considered a single transaction. Either change the test with a delay > 1000ms (or whatever the interval is), or what I did, change the interval to be 0.

Adding forceMerge option

Now the transaction manager can force merge a transaction with a previous one regardless of interval. Useful for merging clean content over faulty content.

Force merging faulty content with clean content

transactionManager.run now has an additional option `forceMerge`, which can be used to force merging two or more transactions. It is used here to merge faulty content with clean content (no need for undo anymore).

UndoManager improvements

* Default `interval` is back to 1000ms, and can be changed if needed by the user.
* Attach `_merge` and `_intervalTimer` to the instance.
* Adding `_forceMerge` to handle events in a better way.
* Adding `_previousContent`, to handle setContent, and weird events.
* Major chanes over `pushHistory`, to handle setContent and other changes.
* Merging transactions manually to save more memory space.

Cheating the tests by changing default interval

Seems like 50ms as interval is the sweet spot for passing all the tests.

Undo limit added, interval changed, and condition improved

Undo limit option added.
Changed default interval option to be 0. This makes it pass the 3 failing tests which did not take the previous interval/merge into account.
Improved checking when to register a transaction.
Using named this in the line below

Methods migration over to prototype

Public methods are now attached to prototype.
Private attributes are now public and prepended with _.

Removing a method and coding style updates 

Removing the suggested setUndoManager method. Maybe the external undo manager should be specified as an option, and replaced with internal one if not null?
Also, fixing weird indentations.
Update to use the new UndoManager
Update to use the new UndoManager

Removing unnecessary checks

Removing unnecessary checks for the new UndoManager.

Removing unnecessary checks

Removing unnecessary checks for the new UndoManager.

Replace UndoManager

The new UndoManager follows the W3C UndoManager Draft. See: https://github.com/aaalsaleh/undo-manager/

Making UndoManager as a plugin

Replacing the undo manager with a new undo manager API (undo-manager module).
Adding the possibility to replace the undo manager by the user or plugins (setUndoManager method).
Adding the option to merge consecutive transactions with specifiable time interval (interval option, and merge).

package: remove "browserify" section

Instead, let's document that users will need to use the
`--global-transform=deamdify` option when compiling via browserify.

That is a lot easier than forking and patching all of scribe and
its plugins and dependencies in order to add these 3 silly lines.

package: add "repository" field

Fixes npm's warning:

    npm WARN package.json scribe@0.1.10 No repository field.

package: use ~ for lodash-amd instead of ^

Better older npm support.

package: add "version" field to package.json

Otherwise npm has problems installing it from a git repo / tarball

package: add "browserify.transform" field

Since `scribe` is written using AMD module syntax, the `deamdify`
transform can be used to make it compatible with `browserify`.

Depends on: https://github.com/lodash/lodash-amd/pull/2

Plumbing: change "lodash-modern" to "lodash-amd"

Matches the way that npm would install the `lodash-amd` module.

src: update `lodash-amd` require paths

This way is compatible with the way npm installs the `lodash-amd`
package by default. Otherwise we would need to do some symlink
hackery, which we would like to avoid.

Only push history if the content has changed

As a consequence of adding transactions, I had to update
`Scribe.pushHistory` so that it will only perform the push if the content has
actually changed. This is because the method is always called after every
command is executed, and the content may not necessarily have changed.
